title: I was given a non-exclusive contract by a Webnovel publishing partner. How legit is it? Will I lose my rights to my work? If it is not good, what platform should I publish on instead? - Quora
tags: Legal Issues and Law in Everyday Life

response.answer_text: Simply put, don't accept it. Web Novel have a case of scammer behavior. The non-exclusive contract is as follows: If you want to get the non-exclusive contract, all what you have to do are : 1. Make sure you publish your story in full English (Not a poem, fan fiction, literature) 2. Please upload all available chapters of your work 3. You should upload your work to Webnovel 2 chapters ahead than another platform 4. Youre the one who decides which chapter to be locked (we suggest you to lock the chapter after more than 20 chapters) 5. You will get pain from the locked chapters once people buy it 6. Once you publish your work/sign the non exclusive with Webnovel you cannot switch to the Royalty one. You can take your time to decide, see with us what you suits the best. Please let me know once you have your decision  If you agree with the rules above, here is the tutorial on uploading your work non-exclusively on Webnovel, remember to upload all the available chapters you have This is the exact words which I was offered. They can't even use proper grammar.
Talk to a lawyer before signing any contract. In the case of publishing a book, you should talk with a lawyer who works in copyright and publishing law.
